top10_tweets_like:
#TidyTuesday Week 29. After a long break, here is my contribution to this week's data. Very satisfied with the result. Also, I found this amazing package {ggnewscale} from @d_olivaw, very useful for design techniques.

#rstats #tidyverse #ggplot #r4ds #dataviz https://t.co/I4mOIQz9bb

Houston, we have a plot! Women in space for this week's #TidyTuesday.

code: https://t.co/Ayjt1Bb27u

#dataviz #RStats https://t.co/iayH8lRurT

Why do you use #RStats? 

Wrong answers only.

TIL — You can pass SQL function as-is in {dbplyr} calls. 

For example, if I want to call postgres `DATE_PART`, I can use it directly in a mutate() call. 

 #RStats #dbplyr https://t.co/jbqkpctsd8

#rstats meets homeschool..  Ellie missed her multiplication rainbow from school so we made one together using ggplot.  Code is here https://t.co/jJZl83JHRS.  It would be cool to see any other educational posters or wallcharts poeple have made with R. https://t.co/0K4MNQFibY
Today in #phytools & #rstats - by user request, mapping a continuous character onto the edges of a tree using variable branch widths: https://t.co/lYc0jKHwWe. https://t.co/JTJb3dCOzv
Supervised ML Case Studies in R, a free on-demand interactive course using Tidy Tools by @juliasilge #rstats https://t.co/514h5hMoqH
